page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT IN THE HOOK AREA
page.content: Even before World War 2 employment was mainly outside the area in the then market town of Basingstoke. Today this is still so with the motorways and railway giving access to centres such as Basingstoke,Farnborough and London. Some work is available in Hook with Edghills-aircraft components, Spice- cocoa mills and Poclain-earthmovers being the major employers. Others include:-THM wood products; B&M and Woodpak: Marr Fish Supplies; Carmen- plumber's supplies; King Bonns- engineers; Ashworth- insulation; W.W. Baggs- landscapers:The building firms of Dabwell and C.H Beavis: The car repair firms of S Watson; Demarco; and M&K: Transport and warehousing firms making use of the good communications are Rawlings; Hazelwood; Priddy & Sons and Melville Marketing.The many farms in the area provide very few jobs.
